intro: Cephalocroton depauperatus, commonly known as the poorleaf cephalocroton, is a small shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its native range.
